items.text: back of a length on middle stump, whipped away nicely to the left of long leg
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Shoaib Malik, 2 runs

items.preText: The latest on Shakib Al Hasan's injury, for those who just tuned in.
items.text: length ball angling into off stump, defended to mid-on
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Shoaib Malik, no run

items.preText: Mashrafe's been holding the back of his right thigh every now and then. Does he have some sort of niggle?
items.text: length ball close to off stump, punched on the up to sweeper cover. He's been timing these front-foot shots beautifully today
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Shoaib Malik, 1 run

items.text: down the track now and he makes a bit of room. Mashrafe offers some too, bowling a pretty full one outside off, and Imam flat-bats it in the air, into the gap to the right of mid-off
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Imam-ul-Haq, FOUR runs

items.text: down the track again and Mashrafe angles it into the batsman this time. Looks to open his bat face and push square on the off side, ends up edging to third man instead
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Imam-ul-Haq, 2 runs

items.text: tossed up nicely outside off, and Malik strides forward for the straight-bat push to long-on
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Shoaib Malik, 1 run

items.text: down the track and Mehidy angles this one in, full, denying room and forcing Imam to clip to midwicket
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

items.text: full on off stump, again bowled slightly round-arm to create an angle into the batsman. Driven to long-on
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

items.text: floated up slow and full outside off, and Malik drives once more, bat scrupulously straight, to long-on
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Shoaib Malik, 1 run

items.text: flat, slides on with the angle towards leg stump. Stays on the back foot, opens up, and punches down to long-on
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

items.text: a touch short, quite wide too, slapped to the fielder at point
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Shoaib Malik, no run

items.preText:
Rubel Hossain comes on now, right-arm over to Imam. I wonder if Mashrafe is fully fit.

Basit: "@Naman if you are removing Fakhar's Zimbabwe series and subtracting 515 runs then minus 5 innings as well, which make his average 37.8, which is not bad by any means. Also he did well in New Zealand where only he scored. Give him some time."
items.text: back of a length, slanting across to off stump, Imam stabs to backward point with an open bat-face
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

items.text: full, close to off stump, drives to mid-off and keeps running as an extension of his front-foot stride. Puts pressure on the fielder and he fumbles as he tries to close down the ball quickly
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

items.text: length ball close to off stump, shows the full face to punch to mid-on
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Shoaib Malik, no run

items.text: back of a length outside off, punched to the left of cover
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Shoaib Malik, 1 run

items.text: full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Imam-ul-Haq, no run

items.text: length ball slanting into a line close to off stump. Steps back and across, waits, and guides to third man with an open face
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

items.preText:
Here's Mahmudullah. Round the wicket to Imam. Crucial phase of play, this. Can Pakistan put Bangladesh's fifth bowler under pressure?

Saad Ali Khan: "Imam-Shoaib is infact the last pair who can bat longer otherwise it's Asif, Hassan, Shadab, Nawaz who can on average bat 20 deliveries before getting themselves out. Can't expect anything from Shadab and Hassan because they've ruined their performance in lieu of over-confidence and funky hair styles." -- Can't funky hairstyles coexist with solid cricketing performance, Saad?

Junaid Khan: "I will hit the winning runs in the last over." -- Right.

Dawood: "Malik has started milking the bowlers. If he continues like this we might witness another Malik Shake as was the case against Afghanistan." -- Zero marks for witty wordplay, but full marks for effort. 

India Fan: "Bangladesh needs to break this partnership real quick if they are to have any chance to win. There is no way they can win this by creating run rate pressure. For a change, I am neutral in my support given the cricket rivalry both these countries have with India :)"

Drinks break.
items.text: back of a length close to off stump, flat-batted down to long-on
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

items.preText: Interesting. Liton Das has taken the keeping gloves from Mushfiqur. I guess he's still struggling with that cramp.
items.text: back of a length, turning towards leg stump, clipped to deep backward square leg
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Shoaib Malik, 1 run

items.text: back of a length, goes with the angle towards middle stump. Makes some room and punches to sweeper cover
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

items.text: short, wide, slapped, but straight to the fielder at cover point
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Shoaib Malik, no run

items.text: quickish length ball close to off stump, pushes gently into the point region and sprints to the other end
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Shoaib Malik, 1 run

items.text: floated up slow outside off, driven to deep point
items.shortText: Mahmudullah to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

items.preText: Rubel Hossain: "I'll take the winning wicket!" -- Impressive that you can bowl and send in ball-by-ball feedback at the same time.
items.text: back of a length close to off stump, steered down to third man
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Imam-ul-Haq, 1 run

items.text: back of a length outside off, opens the face of his bat to dab towards third man
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Shoaib Malik, 1 run
